btv.event.peer

Class PeerCommunicationEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • btv.event.peer.PeerCommunicationEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PeerCommunicationEvent
extends java.util.EventObject
    This class describes a communication event with a peer. A communication event occurs when a message is sent to or received from a peer.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Fields inherited from class java.util.EventObject

      Methods

      boolean dataReceived()
      Find out if this event involved data being received by our peer.
      boolean dataSent()
      Find out if this event involved data being sent by our peer.
      java.lang.String getIP()
      Get the IP address of the peer associated with this event.
      int getMessageType()
      Get the message type that was sent or received.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PeerCommunicationEvent

        public PeerCommunicationEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                      java.lang.String ip1,
                      boolean dataR,
                      boolean dataS,
                      int msgType)
        Constructor to set up a PeerCommunicationEvent.
        Parameters:
        source - The source of the PeerCommunicationEvent
        ip1 - The IP address of the Peer responsible for this event.
        dataR - Set to true if the peer received data.
        dataS - Set to true if the peer sent data.
        msgType - The ID of the message sent or received.

    • Method Detail

      • getIP

        public java.lang.String getIP()
        Get the IP address of the peer associated with this event.
        Returns:
        The IP address of the peer associated with this event.

      • dataReceived

        public boolean dataReceived()
        Find out if this event involved data being received by our peer.
        Returns:
        True if the peer received data, false otherwise.

      • dataSent

        public boolean dataSent()
        Find out if this event involved data being sent by our peer.
        Returns:
        True if our peer sent data, false otherwise.

      • getMessageType

        public int getMessageType()
        Get the message type that was sent or received.
        Returns:
        The ID of the message sent or received.
